array_option_1: What is the current state of the network?
What are the top sources/destinations of flows?
What is the aggregate flow data for data archives?
What are the top flows by organization?
What do individual flows look like?
What are the top flows by country?
What are the flows by science discipline?
What are the flows by project?
Who are the top talkers over time?
What are the patterns in science data transfers in the network?
What are the bandwidth patterns in the network?
What are the patterns of loss in the network?
What are the patterns of latency in the network?
What are the current flow data summary statistics?

panels.content:
Flow Analysis

This dashboard shows SNMP data for the selected link on the SNMP graph below.
It also shows flow pairs and top flows for the selected sensor, organized by the selected source and destination scopes as well as the volume above (in bits) and rate under (in bits per second).
Select flow and SNMP data sources from the lists above, along with source and destination scopes as well as the volume above (in bits) and rate under (in bits per second).
Clicking and dragging on the SNMP graph below will replace the current time range with a custom range based on the selected portion of the graph.
Please note that the flow rate in the flow pairs table will be zero if only one sampled flow was detected.
All times are displayed in browser local time.

options.content:
Flow Analysis

This dashboard shows SNMP data for the selected link on the SNMP graph below.
It also shows flow pairs and top flows for the selected sensor, organized by the selected source and destination scopes as well as the volume above (in bits) and rate under (in bits per second).
Select flow and SNMP data sources from the lists above, along with source and destination scopes as well as the volume above (in bits) and rate under (in bits per second).
Clicking and dragging on the SNMP graph below will replace the current time range with a custom range based on the selected portion of the graph.
Please note that the flow rate in the flow pairs table will be zero if only one sampled flow was detected.
All times are displayed in browser local time.

list.definition: {"find":"terms", "field":"meta.sensor_id.keyword", "query":"(meta.flow_type:sflow OR meta.flow_type:netflow) AND NOT meta.sensor_id:cenic* AND NOT meta.sensor_id:*pacificwave*"}
list.label: Flow Data
list.name: sensors
list.query: {"find":"terms", "field":"meta.sensor_id.keyword", "query":"(meta.flow_type:sflow OR meta.flow_type:netflow) AND NOT meta.sensor_id:cenic* AND NOT meta.sensor_id:*pacificwave*"}

list.definition: get link_name between($START, $END) by link_name from interface where flow_sensors like "$sensors" limit 100 offset 0
list.label: SNMP Data
list.name: links
list.query: get link_name between($START, $END) by link_name from interface where flow_sensors like "$sensors" limit 100 offset 0
